content:
I’m a Ph.D. student in Bioengineering at UC Berkeley (2019–). Before I moved to Berkeley, I spent six years at UCLA and obtained B.S. in Computer Science and Applied Mathematics with Cum Laude (2017) and M.S. in Computer Science (2019).
My past research was on computer vision and medical imaging. In college, I worked on knowledge graph parsing/explainable AI advised by Prof. Song-Chun Zhu. During my M.S., I worked on MRI post-analysis advised by Prof. Kyung Hyun Sung and co-advised by Prof. Fabien Scalzo. My work in prostate imaging AI diagnosis received Best Paper 2nd place in IEEE ISBI 2019.
Besides my research, I spend time on casual downhill skiing, trekking, photography. I was originated from Beijing, China, and my name is pronounced as “Rei-ming Tsao/Chao” :p

title: Ruiming Cao
